question:
Some parents buy their children whatever they ask for, and allow their children to do whatever they want.
Is this a good way to raise children?
What consequences could this style of parenting have for children as they get older?
text: In this day and age, some parents have a tendency to satify the unreasonable demands of their children. This essay will discuss in detail the demerits of this parenting style and detrimental impacts on children's formative years to adult.

This parenting method seems to not to be feasible to educate children effectively. Firstly, children tend to be egocentric on account of being frequently over-indulged. For instance, youngsters might be aggressive if adults do not follow their excessive requests. Secondly, this adverse habit might lead to the consequence that children cannot afford to have a perpetual friendship.

In the long term, children might be adversely influenced by this negative parenting style especially when they get older. Those children who are used to having extravagant requirements have a tendency to obey the rules frequently than the others. First, they might not follow the school statutes such as playing truant and cheating at the exams. Furthermore, they are likely to commit a crime effortlessly when they reach adulthood. This consequence may stem from the fact that there is several rules and complicated issues in workplace that they cannot afford to resolve.
In conclusion, spoiling children seems to be adverse to those youngsters and there must be some solutions to avoid this parenting style.
